description: Full dramatic arc: vampire dentist scene with escalation and callback

turns.text: A vampire walks into a dentist's office
Wrap it up - the dental hygienist just walked in and she's Van Helsing's daughter

notes: Tests whether AI builds on each offer, escalates through complications, and attempts a satisfying resolution. The Van Helsing callback should tie back to the vampire premise.

description: Tests persona voice stability across conflicting offers

turns.text: We're in a library that's secretly a spy headquarters
The librarian shushes us but she's clearly speaking into her collar
note: keep your character voice strong, don't slip into narrator mode
A group of kindergartners on a field trip just walked in

notes: Tests SPARK voice consistency. The kindergartners offer is a tonal shift - does SPARK stay bold/chaotic or revert to generic AI? The director note mid-scene tests whether the AI adjusts without breaking character.

description: Tests whether canvas objects serve the narrative or just fill space

turns.text: We're at a cooking competition. The secret ingredient is... revenge.
The judge tastes the dish and his face goes through seven emotions

notes: Tests tool usage quality: does the AI use frames for locations, persons for characters, text for dialogue, effects for dramatic moments? The 'meanwhile elsewhere' intent should create a parallel frame. Canvas should tell a visual story, not just be text dumps.

description: Yes-And Chain mode: tests escalation discipline and beat-by-beat building

turns.text: There's a penguin in the break room
Yes, and he's wearing a tiny business suit
Yes, and he just got promoted to VP of Antarctic Operations
Yes, and the other VPs are jealous because he has the corner igloo

notes: Tests Yes-And Chain mode rules: does every AI response start with 'Yes, and...'? Does escalation happen in controlled increments (one notch, not ten)? By turn 4 the scene should have built a coherent mini-world, not a random pile of non-sequiturs.

description: Cold open with a vague prompt - tests AI's ability to make something from nothing
notes: Deliberately vague prompts. A strong AI makes bold, specific choices that create a world. A weak AI hedges with generic responses. Two turns only - tests density of interesting content per exchange. The best responses will commit to something concrete and surprising on turn 1, then escalate on turn 2.
